clinical_study.brief_title: Hypnosis in Pain Management of Mucositis Lesions, Anxiety and Depression in Oncological Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Hypnosis as a Complementary Practice in Pain Management of Mucositis Lesions, Anxiety and Depression in Oncological Patients

oversight_info.authority: Brazil: National Committee of Ethics in Research

brief_summary.textblock: This study's aim is to use hypnosis in cancer patients with mucositis (grades 1,2 or 3), caused by radiotherapy, in order to reduce the level of pain in the mucositis lesions, as well as anxiety and depression, as compared to the control group. For this evaluation development scales of mucositis proposed by World Health Organization (WHO), the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) and Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale ( HADS) will be used.

detailed_description.textblock: Voluntary Oncology Patients of both sexes, aged between 18 and 80 years old, without neurological or psychiatric disorders that present degree of mucositis (1,2 or 3) will be randomly distributed into 2 groups of 40 participants each. Both groups will receive treatment protocol for the application of low-power laser. All participants will be assessed using the mucositis Development Scale proposed by the WHO, by 3 different examiners and will answer the variables control record as well as the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) and Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) in 3 different moments, at the beginning of the study, after 3 days and after 2 weeks from the second evaluation. The experimental group will evaluate the effects of hypnosis on the intensity of the pain in mucositis lesions, as well as depression and anxiety. The control group will only follow the treatment protocol mentioned above, being monitored by the scales as to the progression of symptoms.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Supportive Care

primary_outcome.measure: Decrease of score of pain of mucositis in the Visual Analogic Scale, using hypnosis.
primary_outcome.description: Compare through the scores on the Visual Analogic Scale (VAS) the effect of hypnosis in reducing the pain caused by mucositis among the 40 patients of the experimental group and the 40 patients of the control group. To measure the development of mucositis the scale from World Health Organization will be used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Decrease of anxiety and depression with the use of hypnosis.
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison between the experimental group and the control group as to the effect of hypnosis in reducing anxiety and depression, using for this the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS): which has 14 items, seven of which are directed to the evaluation of anxiety (HADS-A) and seven to depression (HADS - D).

arm_group.description: Use of hypnosis in the reduction of the levels of pain from mucositis lesions, depression and anxiety.
Comparison of the effects of hypnosis between the control group and the experimental group regarding pain, anxiety and depression with the application of the scales.

intervention.description: The hypnosis intervention consists of two 40-minute sessions, with an interval of 3 days between them, emphasizing the pain blocking, the well-being of the patient and the reduction of the symptoms of anxiety and depression of the same.

The control and experimental groups respond in 3 different distinct moments, with the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) for the evaluation of pain, and the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) to evaluate the depression and the anxiety. The first evaluation will be made before the research. The second within an interval of 3 days, so being that in the experimental group the same will happen after the hypnosis session and in the control group after the follow-up visit. The third evaluation will be two weeks later, in order to provide a follow-up to assess the efficacy of the technique. The experimental group and the control group will be compared in relation to the intensity of the pain of mucositis lesions, and depression and anxiety

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with mucositis resulting from cancer treatment , regardless of the location of the primary tumor , chemotherapy or radiation may or may not have concomitant surgical indication.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients outside this age range , users of psychotropic drugs , patients terminally ill with cancer , psychiatric patients , hearing impaired , patients with mental disabilities such as Down syndrome , autism and others.
